item.title: scratch
item.description: Where we run into trouble with rapamycin is that ME/CFS is highly cell-type-specific: • Monocytes, many effector CD8+ T cells, and microglia tend to show mTOR hyperactivation → rapamycin calms these down.

item.title: Cell Danger Response (CDR)
item.description: ME/CFS, CDR, and Treatments — crisp notes Conceptual model Illness sustained by a chronic Cell Danger Response (CDR) with immune exhaustion, mitochondrial dysfunction, limbic sensitization, and persistent alarmins.

item.title: ME/CFS Treatment Protocol - v0.1

item.title: Conversations Excerpts: A.S.
item.description: analyisis of my immune status: I am not usually a massive fan of Dr Patterson’s cytokine panels, but I really like this particular result Immune activation is weighted towards Th2 (IL-4, IL-13), which neatly explains MCAS - Th2 T cells encourage humoral immunity via B cell stimulation → IgE I consid...

item.title: Conversation Excerpts: D.C.
item.description: Viral driver of ME (WTHHF) In us humans it’s almost impossible with the approved antivirals to remove viral infections like EBV, CMV, HHV6 from the central nervous system.

item.title: Conversation Excerpts: S.
item.description: Ablify If it’s Abilify, I just wanted to let you know that I have a friend who has remained mostly asymptomatic thanks to Abilify.
